events.message: The customer has filed a claim reporting a collision involving their vehicle on a busy city street during morning traffic.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under auto accident after confirming the involvement of a personal car and collision circumstances.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the auto accident claim and will coordinate further investigation steps.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and is now in process.
The insurance company requested the customer to submit photos of vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates.
The customer has submitted all requested documents including the accident report, photos, and repair costs for the damaged car.
An investigation was initiated to verify the details of the car collision and assess liability and extent of vehicle damage.
The investigation into the vehicle accident is complete, confirming that the claim details and damages claimed are valid.
A settlement offer has been proposed to the customer covering repairs, towing fees, and temporary transportation costs.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the promptness of the proposed settlement amount.
The auto accident claim was approved by management, confirming the settlement terms and payment processing.
Payment for the approved claim was issued to the customerâ€™s designated account to cover the vehicle repair expenses.
The insurance claim for the auto accident was officially closed following successful payment and customer confirmation.
All documentation and records related to the auto accident claim have been archived for future reference and compliance.
